result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI Cause Injury (2+) and PAC Cause Injury (2+). The defendant was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+) and the other charge, PAC Cause Injury (2+) was dismissed by the court.

  • Richard E. Renoll was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IID requirement applies to all vehicles which are registered in your name and any vehicles you operate.  During your IID requirement period, you may not operate any motor vehicle without an IID installed.

miscConds.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at time of sentencing, unless payment arrangements are approved.  Penalty for non-payment shall be entry of civil judgment.   Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 423, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808.

Pay all fees and costs.
Follow rules of the Department.
Attend any counseling deemed appropriate.
Obtain a COMPAS assessment and follow recommendations.
Provide a DNA sample unless previously submitted.

timeConds.notes:
Granted Huber and good time.
Defendant to contact WRC within 72 hours to schedule a report date.  Sentence to begin within 60 days.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

OWI CAUSE INJURY (2+); CONDITIONS:    ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  NO POSSESSION OR CONSUMPTION OF ALCOHOL.  NO POSSESSION OR CONSUMPTION OF ILLEGAL CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES OR DRUG PARAPHERNALIA.  NO POSSESSION OR CONSUMPTION OF CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES UNLESS PRESCRIBED BY PHYSICIAN.  COMPLY WITH CONDITIONS OF THE ALCOHOL 24/7 PROGRAM. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  NO DRIVING WITHOUT VALID DRIVER'S LICENSE.  REPORT TO WINNEBAGO COUNTY JAIL FOR FINGERPRINTING AND PHOTO PURSUANT TO WIS STATS 970.02(7).  NO BARS.
Defendant Richard E. Renoll in court.  Michael J. Balskus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE to go to public defender's office.  Further proceedings scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 09:00 am.
